child.name: Market Research (Voice of Customers)
child.comment: Market research shows whats are the different products available and their market share. It also shows what exactly is the customer wants and need.

child.name: Competitive Analysis
child.comment: This shows different products and their offerings in the given domain.

child.name: MGPP
child.comment: From the Market research and Competitive analysis we prepare the Multi Generation product Plan

child.name: Product Requirement Specifications
child.comment: Depending upon the product generation the product requirements specifications are created.

child.name: Persona
child.comment: This shows the different persona in the given domain along with their roles, responsibilities and goals which they are trying to achieve.

child.name: Context Scenaio
child.comment: This shows how the persona achive their goals.

child.name: WireFrame
child.comment: This shows the User interaction with the system, its screen flow, in achieving different goals.

child.name: Software Requirement Specifications
child.comment: This shows the software requirement.

child.name: Installation Requirements
child.comment: What are the different mode of installation available, CD, USB, Web, Cloud. How the installation are send to the user.

child.name: Upgrade Requirements
child.comment: How the upgrade are patches are send to the customer

child.name: Licensing Requirements
child.comment: This shows the different licensing requirement

child.name: Security Requirements
child.comment: Security Requirements.

child.name: Threat Modeling
child.comment: The system context diagram is used for modeling the threat to the system and the mitigation plan. These mitigation plan may add additional requierments

child.name: User Authentication
child.comment: How user is authenticated

child.name: User Authorization
child.comment: How user is authorized to perform different tasks.

child.name: User Account Management
child.comment: How users are managed

child.name: Password Encryption
child.comment: Password encryption and policies

child.name: Non Functional CTQs
child.comment: Non function requirements on the system

child.name: System Test Cases
child.comment: Each scenarion may give rise to one or more system test cases.

child.name: Stories
child.comment: The procedure and steps to achieve goals are translated into stories

child.name: Acceptance Criteria
child.comment: Each story is given acceptance criteria. The criteria to release the software

child.name: Safer
child.comment: The Safer requirement

child.name: TRS Document
child.comment: The TRS requirement

child.name: Applicable Design Practices
child.comment: It helps in recognizing and reusing the design practices

child.name: Quality Attributes
child.comment: Quality attributes define attributes that affects the overall system design, runtime, design time and user centric issues

child.name: Architectural Principles
child.comment: Architectural principles relates the business objectives and key architecture drivers

child.name: Business Domain Model
child.comment: Domain objects and their relation in a particular business

child.name: Subsystem Design
child.comment: Diagram showing different subsystems, theirs roles and responsibilities

child.name: API Design
child.comment: Diagram showing different api that is used to access, change the domain objects

child.name: Database Design
child.comment: Design showing different tables and their relationship in storing the domain objects persistently in the database.

child.name: Class Diagram
child.comment: Subsystems are broken in different classes that handle a particular responsibility in meeting the user goal scenario

child.name: Component and Connector Diagram
child.comment: It represents different components, their interface and interactions with the other components.

child.name: System Context Diagram
child.comment: The diagram shows the boundaries between the systems and its environment. Interaction of different entities in the system

child.name: Deployment Diagram
child.comment: Deployment of different software artifacts

child.name: Technology Accessment
child.comment: Depending upon the problem in hand, evaluation different technologies based on the options provided for each properties

child.name: Risk Assement & Planning
child.comment: Document showing the risks, severity and probability and its mitigation plan along with follow up actions

child.name: Quality Plan
child.comment: Document specifying quality standards, practices, resources, specifications and sequence of activities of project

child.name: Development Machines
child.comment: Define the configuration and quantity of development machines

child.name: Compiler
child.comment: Different tools that are used to create the binaries, executable deployments

child.name: Client Side IDE
child.comment: Different tools that are used to create the code for client side application

child.name: Server Side IDE
child.comment: Different tools that are used to create the code for server side application

child.name: Component or Libraries
child.comment: Define the additional libraries or component that will be used, find its licensing requirement, acquisition procedure

child.name: Test Machines
child.comment: Define the configuration and quantity of test machines

child.name: Unit Testing Tools
child.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

child.name: Component Testing Tools
child.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

child.name: Integration Testing Tools
child.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

child.name: Performance Testing Tools
child.comment: Define the testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

child.name: Reliability Testing Tools
child.comment: Define the integration testing tools required, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

child.name: Code Coverage Tools
child.comment: Define the code coverage tools required for different languages, number, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition procedure

child.name: Database
child.comment: Define the database required, quantity, licensing requirement and acquisition

child.name: Agile Development Process
child.comment: Document describing the agile development process, with details steps

child.name: Backlog Management
child.comment: Select the tools that will be used for backlog management, configuration and use of that tool

child.name: Team
child.comment: Create a team with their roles and responsibilities.

child.name: Stake Holders
child.comment: Analyze different stake holders, their roles and responsibilities.

child.name: Backlog Creation
child.comment: Create a prioritize backlog of each items from the stories defined above.

child.name: Estimation
child.comment: Estimate each stories, if there are unknown then give 13 pointer to the story and define a spike before it. Spike should be taken before the story in a sprint.

child.name: Budgeting
child.comment: Define the budget requirement

child.name: Resource Planning
child.comment: Define the teams, roles and responsibilities of each team members

child.name: Scrum
child.comment: Define the scrum cycle, scrum master, retrospection and escalation plans etc

child.name: Release Planning
child.comment: Plan the complete release based on the prioritized stores

child.name: Working Agreement
child.comment: Define the working agreement of the team with the stake holder.

child.name: Stop the line Criteria
child.comment: Define when to raise stop the line and who will raise it

child.name: CTH Approvals
child.comment: Define what'll are required for CTH approval

child.name: NCA and RCA
child.comment: Define the NCA and RCA process and when to activate it.

child.name: Communication Plan
child.comment: Define the communication plan

child.name: Ready-Ready Expectations
child.comment: Define the ready-ready expectation for each story

child.name: Done-Done Expectations
child.comment: Define the done-done criteria for each story

child.name: Sprint Planning
child.comment: Define the sprint planning process

child.name: Retrospection
child.comment: Define and capture various restrospection from the team. How it is communicated and use.

child.name: Demo
child.comment: Define how the demo will be done.

child.name: Agile Management Tool
child.comment: Define the agile management tools that will be use by the team, licensing, cost and other managemet aspects

child.name: Configuration Management
child.comment: Define the configuraiton management tools that will be use by the team, licensing, cost and other management aspects

child.name: Source Control Server Setup
child.comment: Define the server requirement for control the project source code.

child.name: Production Source
child.comment: Define how production source will be organized. Who willl have what kind of permissions

child.name: Unit Test Source
child.comment: Define how unit test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

child.name: Component Test Source
child.comment: Define how component test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

child.name: Integration Test Source
child.comment: Define how integration test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

child.name: Performance Test Source
child.comment: Define how unit test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

child.name: Reliability Test Source
child.comment: Define how unit test source will be organized. Who will have what kind of permissions.

child.name: Setting Up Build Machine
child.comment: Document showing the steps required to setup the build machine

child.name: Setting up Slave Machines
child.comment: Document showing the steps required to setup the slave machine

child.name: Smoke Test
child.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the smoke test, procedure and dashboard requirements

child.name: Component Tests
child.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the component test, procedure and dashboard requirements

child.name: Regression Tests
child.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the regression test, procedure and dashboard requirements

child.name: Static Analysis
child.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the static analysis, procedure and dashboard requirements

child.name: Code Coverage
child.comment: Steps required for setting up, running the code coverage, procedure and dashboard requirements

child.name: Backward Compatibility Strategy
child.comment: Document describing how the new product allow for interoperability with an older system

child.name: Exception Handling Strategy
child.comment: Document describing how the new product handle, log and propagate exception occuring inside the system

child.name: Logging Strategy
child.comment: Document what information are logged and how it is stored in the system so that logs are effective to diagnose coding errors

child.name: Globalization Strategy
child.comment: Document depending upon the technologies what care has to be taken in order to make the system globalized.

child.name: Localization Strategy
child.comment: Document the procedure to support other non-english languages

child.name: Licensing Strategy
child.comment: Document the procedure for supporting different licensing requirements

child.name: Modularity Strategy
child.comment: Set of standards, rules and guidelines for all contributors to follow

child.name: Versioning Strategy
child.comment: Document the rule how version number are assigned, incremented and used

child.name: Backup and Restore Strategy
child.comment: Document mentioning various options of backing up system based on the time and space, and restoring it back

child.name: Upgrade Strategy
child.comment: Document mentioning the various components that will be upgraded in case of system upgrade. How they will be upgraded and what care needs to be taken if upgrade fails.

child.name: Test Strategy
child.comment: Document mentioning about the various testing that will be done on the system with the reasons, the resource requirements etc

child.name: Crash Dump Strategy
child.comment: Documenting showing what needs to be done in case of crash reported on various systems

child.name: Customer Reported Defect Strategy
child.comment: Documenting mentioning what information needs to be collected if Defect is resported on the field on customer site that will help the development team to reproduce the defects quickly

child.name: UX Best Practices
child.comment: Best Practices to build the fluid user experiences

child.name: MemoryValidator
child.comment: Memory Validator checks the memory leaks, resource and handle leak in C++ application
